result.execSummary:
The defendant Hannah L. Reischl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CJTS probation.  Review Hearing scheduled in Br 6 on 3-3-2016 @ 1:15 pm.

**08-02-2016 - Court revokes CJTS probation.  Court orders State probation until 11-25-16.

**09-12-2016 - Court amends judgment to 6 months probation effective 8-2-2016.

miscConds.notes:
The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to have no contact with co-defendant, JK.  Court orders expungement per Wisconsin Statute #973.015, upon successful completion of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

**08-02-2016 - Court adds:  No drugs unless prescribed by a physician and only in the amounts prescribed.
State has 45 days to file a claim for restitution.  Defendant is to pay full restitution by 3-3-2016.

timeConds.notes: Stayed.  Must serve if costs and restitution are not paid by 3-3-2016.
Defendant is to complete at least half of hours by 3-3-2016.
